main event: A civilian witness observed a round, reddish object the size of a wash tub that hovered for 8 seconds before disappearing below the tree line in Muskwa, British Columbia, Canada on February 2, 1962.
interesting points: The object had two funnels of fire.
The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute, but the object was only visible for about 8 seconds.
Fort St. John weather reports indicated a meteorite in the northeast quadrant at the same time as the sighting.
The Air Force analysis concluded the sighting was likely a meteoric motion, with the witness overestimating the duration of the event.
This sighting was reported and investigated as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's UFO study program.
sighted object: round, reddish object the size of a wash tub
